title_it: 6th Symposium on Nephrolithiasis of the Fondazione Menarini GENETICS OF NEPHROLITHIASIS AND NEPHROLITHIASIS FOR NEPHROLOGISTS: AN INTRODUCTORY COURSE in cooperation with the Slovenian Society of Nephrology
title_en: 6th Symposium on Nephrolithiasis of the Fondazione Menarini GENETICS OF NEPHROLITHIASIS AND NEPHROLITHIASIS FOR NEPHROLOGISTS: AN INTRODUCTORY COURSE in cooperation with the Slovenian Society of Nephrology
venue: HOTEL EXE LEV, Vošnjakova ulica 1, 1000 Ljubljana, Slovenia
presentationDescription_it: <p style="text-align: left; margin: 0pt 0pt 8pt; line-height: 1.07917;"><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><strong>RATIONALE</strong> <br /><br />The most severe forms of nephrolithiasis are Mendelian disorders. <br />Although rare, these forms should be diagnosed because they may have specific treatments. <br />Their recognition is key to personalized/precision medicine. <br />It is the case of type I primary hyperoxaluria, a dramatic condition that has now a treatment. <br />Many of the monogenic forms of nephrolithiasis are associated with nephrocalcinosis. <br />This is an almost neglected condition of which even the definition is unclear. <br />To define what nephrocalcinosis is, the meeting will start with the presentation of the preliminary results of a Consensus Document written by a group of experts that join the competence in bone <br />and mineral abnormalities of CKD (the working group of ERA on CKDMBD) <br />and the bone and mineral abnormalities of nephrolithiasis (the Faculty of the 6th Symposium). <br />We are facing a sort of crisis in treating patients with nephrolithiasis. <br />On one side, the terrific technological advancement that has brought in the surgical theatre tools for truly mini-invasive treatments of stones, absorbing almost totally the attention of urologists who have less and less time for stone metaphylaxis; on the other, very few nephrologists know how to do stone metaphylaxis because the easy non-invasive removal of stones is perceived as sufficient. However, behind nephrolithiasis, severe conditions may be present, including the genetic forms that frequently lead to CKD and ESKD, among many others. Their diagnosis is crucial for giving specific treatments. However, even in the idiopathic cases of nephrolithiasis, the quality of life of the patient may be compromised because of pain, hospital admissions, urological treatments, days lost at work, etc. These patients, too, need efficacious treatments. This is why we, in cooperation with the Slovenian Society of Nephrology, have dedicated the last part of the Symposium to an introductory course on Nephrolithiasis for nephrologists. We hope that this will help to spread the knowledge and the skills necessary to nephrologists for treating patients <br />with nephrolithiasis, to give them better prognosis and quality of life.</span></p>
presentationDescription_en: <p style="text-align: left; margin: 0pt 0pt 8pt; line-height: 1.07917;"><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 10pt;"><strong>RATIONALE</strong><br /> <br />The most severe forms of nephrolithiasis are Mendelian disorders. <br />Although rare, these forms should be diagnosed because they may have specific treatments. <br />Their recognition is key to personalized/precision medicine. <br />It is the case of type I primary hyperoxaluria, a dramatic condition that has now a treatment. <br />Many of the monogenic forms of nephrolithiasis are associated with nephrocalcinosis. <br />This is an almost neglected condition of which even the definition is unclear. <br />To define what nephrocalcinosis is, the meeting will start with the presentation of the preliminary results of a Consensus Document written by a group of experts that join the competence in bone <br />and mineral abnormalities of CKD (the working group of ERA on CKDMBD) <br />and the bone and mineral abnormalities of nephrolithiasis (the Faculty of the 6th Symposium). <br />We are facing a sort of crisis in treating patients with nephrolithiasis. <br />On one side, the terrific technological advancement that has brought in the surgical theatre tools for truly mini-invasive treatments of stones, absorbing almost totally the attention of urologists who have less and less time for stone metaphylaxis; on the other, very few nephrologists know how to do stone metaphylaxis because the easy non-invasive removal of stones is perceived as sufficient. However, behind nephrolithiasis, severe conditions may be present, including the genetic forms that frequently lead to CKD and ESKD, among many others. Their diagnosis is crucial for giving specific treatments. However, even in the idiopathic cases of nephrolithiasis, the quality of life of the patient may be compromised because of pain, hospital admissions, urological treatments, days lost at work, etc. These patients, too, need efficacious treatments. This is why we, in cooperation with the Slovenian Society of Nephrology, have dedicated the last part of the Symposium to an introductory course on Nephrolithiasis for nephrologists. We hope that this will help to spread the knowledge and the skills necessary to nephrologists for treating patients <br />with nephrolithiasis, to give them better prognosis and quality of life.</span></p>

title_it: From Vessels to Ventilation: A Comprehensive Approach to Cardio-Respiratory Disease
title_en: From Vessels to Ventilation: A Comprehensive Approach to Cardio-Respiratory Disease
venue: Hotel Tesoro Los Cabos, Blvd. Paseo de la Marina Lote 9 y 10, Centro, Marina, 23450 Cabo San Lucas, B.C.S.
presentationDescription_it: <p dir="ltr" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases continue to be the leading causes of death worldwide.</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">During the past years, pro-active prevention strategies, novel diagnostic approaches and more effective</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">treatments have succeeded in not onlysignificantly reducing morbidity and mortality, but also increasing the life expectancy. We would like to invite you to join us for an innovative educational experience that will strengthen your every day practice. The symposium is designed to deliver an engaging forum to critically examined evidence-based strategies as well as contemporary best practices and clinical decision making to reach our common objective of improving heart and lung health of patients with cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases. The congress brings together international and local expertises to the Cardiology and Respiratory field. We encourage you to ignite conversations with faculty from leading societies through the region and create connections. During this 2-day meeting you will have the opportunity to contribute to the</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">highest level of cardiovascular and respiratory science going through a very rich scientific programme, and together with local and international speakers we will address the most important risk factors and hot topics in cardiovascular and respiratory medicine and co-morbidities, as well as recently published guidelines. Strive to be your best and join us in our vision of a world where innovation and knowledge optimize cardiovascular and pulmonary care and outcomes.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Athanasios Manolis</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Geraldo Payro Ramirez</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Nicola Scichilone</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">Co-Presidents of the Meeting</span></p>
presentationDescription_en: <p dir="ltr" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases continue to be the leading causes of death worldwide.</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">During the past years, pro-active prevention strategies, novel diagnostic approaches and more effective</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">treatments have succeeded in not onlysignificantly reducing morbidity and mortality, but also increasing the life expectancy. We would like to invite you to join us for an innovative educational experience that will strengthen your every day practice. The symposium is designed to deliver an engaging forum to critically examined evidence-based strategies as well as contemporary best practices and clinical decision making to reach our common objective of improving heart and lung health of patients with cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases. The congress brings together international and local expertises to the Cardiology and Respiratory field. We encourage you to ignite conversations with faculty from leading societies through the region and create connections. During this 2-day meeting you will have the opportunity to contribute to the</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">highest level of cardiovascular and respiratory science going through a very rich scientific programme, and together with local and international speakers we will address the most important risk factors and hot topics in cardiovascular and respiratory medicine and co-morbidities, as well as recently published guidelines. Strive to be your best and join us in our vision of a world where innovation and knowledge optimize cardiovascular and pulmonary care and outcomes.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Athanasios Manolis</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Geraldo Payro Ramirez</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Nicola Scichilone</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">Co-Presidents of the Meeting</span></p>

title_it: International Symposium on: Advances in Clinical Cardiology, Valvular Heart Disease and Cardiovascular Imaging
title_en: International Symposium on: Advances in Clinical Cardiology, Valvular Heart Disease and Cardiovascular Imaging
presentationDescription_it: <h1 style="text-align: center;"><strong style="font-size: 12px;">RATIONALE</strong></h1><div><div style="text-align: center;">Cardiovascular disease remains the leading cause of mortality across</div><div style="text-align: center;">the industrialized countries. It is important that cardiologists be both</div><div style="text-align: center;">skilled and aware on contemporary best practices to ensure that</div><div style="text-align: center;">patients receive appropriate best-quality care. The present International</div><div style="text-align: center;">Symposium on “Advances in Clinical Cardiology, Valvular Heart Disease</div><div style="text-align: center;">and Cardiovascular Imaging” is designed to provide clinicians updated</div><div style="text-align: center;">reviews of the latest science and cutting-edge advances.</div><div style="text-align: center;">Modern cardiovascular imaging techniques, not only 2D and 3D</div><div style="text-align: center;">echocardiography but also computed tomography and magnetic</div><div style="text-align: center;">resonance imaging, are designed as a common thread connecting</div><div style="text-align: center;">clinical cardiology, understood as an integral part of internal medicine,</div><div style="text-align: center;">to diagnosis, surgical and interventional treatment of diseases of cardiac</div><div style="text-align: center;">valves, a field that is showing impressive development in recent years.</div><div style="text-align: center;">Very expert and authoritative international speakers will illustrate the</div><div style="text-align: center;">most recent diagnostic and therapeutic advances in the field of clinical</div><div style="text-align: center;">cardiology, with particular attention to valvular diseases. Large space</div><div style="text-align: center;">will be reserved for collegial discussion between experts with the active</div><div style="text-align: center;">involvement of the audience. Main goal is for participants to incorporate</div><div style="text-align: center;">the most recent advances in cardiovascular care in leading Hospitals</div><div style="text-align: center;">and to ensure knowledge for the translation to clinical daily practice.</div><p style="text-align: center;"><br /></p><div style="text-align: center;"><strong>Francesco Antonini-Canterin</strong></div><br /></div><p><br /></p>
presentationDescription_en: <p style="text-align: center;"><strong>RATIONALE</strong></p><div style="text-align: center;">Cardiovascular disease remains the leading cause of mortality across</div><div style="text-align: center;">the industrialized countries. It is important that cardiologists be both</div><div style="text-align: center;">skilled and aware on contemporary best practices to ensure that</div><div style="text-align: center;">patients receive appropriate best-quality care. The present International</div><div style="text-align: center;">Symposium on “Advances in Clinical Cardiology, Valvular Heart Disease</div><div style="text-align: center;">and Cardiovascular Imaging” is designed to provide clinicians updated</div><div style="text-align: center;">reviews of the latest science and cutting-edge advances.</div><div style="text-align: center;">Modern cardiovascular imaging techniques, not only 2D and 3D</div><div style="text-align: center;">echocardiography but also computed tomography and magnetic</div><div style="text-align: center;">resonance imaging, are designed as a common thread connecting</div><div style="text-align: center;">clinical cardiology, understood as an integral part of internal medicine,</div><div style="text-align: center;">to diagnosis, surgical and interventional treatment of diseases of cardiac</div><div style="text-align: center;">valves, a field that is showing impressive development in recent years.</div><div style="text-align: center;">Very expert and authoritative international speakers will illustrate the</div><div style="text-align: center;">most recent diagnostic and therapeutic advances in the field of clinical</div><div style="text-align: center;">cardiology, with particular attention to valvular diseases. Large space</div><div style="text-align: center;">will be reserved for collegial discussion between experts with the active</div><div style="text-align: center;">involvement of the audience. Main goal is for participants to incorporate</div><div style="text-align: center;">the most recent advances in cardiovascular care in leading Hospitals</div><div style="text-align: center;">and to ensure knowledge for the translation to clinical daily practice.</div><p style="text-align: center;"><br /></p><div style="text-align: center;"><strong>Francesco Antonini-Canterin</strong></div>

title_it: FIRST INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON HFpEF: BRIDGING DISCIPLINES
title_en: FIRST INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON HFpEF: BRIDGING DISCIPLINES
venue: Palazzo Emilio Turati Via Meravigli 9/B - 20121 Milano
presentationDescription_it: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center; font-weight: 400;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;"><strong>INTRO SPEECH</strong><br /></span></strong></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">The escalating global prevalence of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">(HFpEF) underscores the urgency of addressing its intricate pathophysiology</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">with a circulatory system-wide strategy. HFpEF, a multifaceted syndrome</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">extending well beyond the myocardium, has profound implications for both</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">individual health and societal well-being.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">In recent years, there has been a significant expansion in recognizing the</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">importance of HFpEF, highlighting that a comprehensive approach is essential</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">to achieve meaningful progress in its diagnosis and therapy. Unlike other forms</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">of heart failure, HFpEF involves challenges that extend beyond the heart itself,</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">necessitating a broader perspective that encompasses disciplines such as cardioimmunology,</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">cardio-nephrology, and cardio-metabolism. This recognition is</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">pivotal in shaping the landscape of cardiovascular health and advancing insights</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">in HFpEF pathophysiology.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">This focused meeting centered on HFpEF seeks to fill this crucial gap, assembling</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">global thought leaders to share insights and foster collaborative efforts. Our</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">focus on “bridging disciplines” emphasizes that attention to the systemic nature</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">of the HFpEF syndrome is essential.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">The impact of HFpEF on society is profound, as it not only affects individual</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">health but also places a substantial burden on healthcare systems worldwide. By</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">concentrating on HFpEF, we aim to define the next phase of advances in research</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">and clinical practice, providing a platform for high-level scientific presentations,</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">discussions, and interactions. This specialized gathering holds the potential</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">to shape the trajectory of HFpEF management, ultimately improving health</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">outcomes and contributing to the broader goals of cardiovascular health on a</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">global scale.</span></p><div style="text-align: center;"><br /></div><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">The Presidents of the Meeting</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Joseph A. Hill</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Harriette Van Spall</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Gianluigi Condorelli</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Gabriele G. Schiattarella</span></p>
presentationDescription_en: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;"><strong>INTRO SPEECH</strong><br /></span></strong></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">The escalating global prevalence of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">(HFpEF) underscores the urgency of addressing its intricate pathophysiology</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">with a circulatory system-wide strategy. HFpEF, a multifaceted syndrome</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">extending well beyond the myocardium, has profound implications for both</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">individual health and societal well-being.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">In recent years, there has been a significant expansion in recognizing the</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">importance of HFpEF, highlighting that a comprehensive approach is essential</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">to achieve meaningful progress in its diagnosis and therapy. Unlike other forms</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">of heart failure, HFpEF involves challenges that extend beyond the heart itself,</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">necessitating a broader perspective that encompasses disciplines such as cardioimmunology,</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">cardio-nephrology, and cardio-metabolism. This recognition is</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">pivotal in shaping the landscape of cardiovascular health and advancing insights</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">in HFpEF pathophysiology.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">This focused meeting centered on HFpEF seeks to fill this crucial gap, assembling</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">global thought leaders to share insights and foster collaborative efforts. Our</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">focus on “bridging disciplines” emphasizes that attention to the systemic nature</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">of the HFpEF syndrome is essential.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">The impact of HFpEF on society is profound, as it not only affects individual</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">health but also places a substantial burden on healthcare systems worldwide. By</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">concentrating on HFpEF, we aim to define the next phase of advances in research</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">and clinical practice, providing a platform for high-level scientific presentations,</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">discussions, and interactions. This specialized gathering holds the potential</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">to shape the trajectory of HFpEF management, ultimately improving health</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">outcomes and contributing to the broader goals of cardiovascular health on a</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">global scale.</span></p><div style="text-align: center;"><br /></div><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">The Presidents of the Meeting</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Joseph A. Hill</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Harriette Van Spall</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Gianluigi Condorelli</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">Prof. Gabriele G. Schiattarella</span></p>

title_it: Postoperative pain: An enemy to fight
title_en: Postoperative pain: An enemy to fight
presentationDescription_it: <p style="color: #242424; font-family: &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, &quot;Segoe UI Web (West European)&quot;, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, Roboto, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; text-decoration-color: initial; text-align: center;"><strong><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; white-space: pre-wrap;">PRESENTATION </span></strong></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">The management of postoperative pain is a challenging concern for the perioperative health care providers. The most important scientific societies interested either in pain, in surgery, and several others, including the ones supporting the scientific aspects of nursing worldwide have largely debated this topic in the last decades. The majority of them has produced guidelines either general or for specific aspects of the topic. So, at the moment the literature is plenty of important and well-done guidelines, but still the patients affording a surgical intervention are not completely well treated. Certainly, knowledge of the topic is better than it was 30-40 years ago but we are still far from optimal. More and more problems emerge and each of them requires a specific approach.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">The ancient attitude of complete disinterest in this topic, especially on the part of surgeons, has gradually been replaced by important issues such as the absolute indispensability of an optimal organization of the service, in order to guarantee sufficient and continuous analgesia. The next step concerned the quality of the analgesics to be administered and/or the combination of different methodologies to obtain patient satisfaction.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">The so-called “opioid crisis”, an almost exclusively American phenomenon, has unleashed a real hurricane in treatment, with an almost total refusal to use this important class of analgesic drugs in postoperative patients. Today the positions are less drastic, having obtained data regarding the real extent of the problem and being less worried; although there are still some who are convinced that the total abolition of post-operative opioids represents the only possibility to prevent potential drug addiction post-surgery.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">Other aspects are decidedly more interesting for those interested in the well-being of patients undergoing surgery. The chronicity of untreated or poorly treated acute pain is undoubtedly a very hot topic.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">The surgical approach to diseases has also changed, especially with the introduction of new technologies, which have effectively revolutionized surgery. Among other interesting aspects, the evident increase in day-hospital interventions emerges. How to treat postoperative pain in those patients is a very attractive topic, from a scientific and clinical point of view, given that those patients are often discharged from hospital without adequate analgesia. This causes a high incidence of post-operative hospital readmissions solely due to persistent or intolerable pain on the part of the patient.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; white-space: pre-wrap;">The Fondazione Internazionale Menarini (FIM) felt it was important to organize a cultural and educational event that explored these various themes. We all hope that the organized program can satisfy some of the needs also present in this geographical area. This in the exclusive interest of the patients who are in our thoughts and to whom we direct all our scientific and educational attention. We are honored that FIM wanted the Paolo Procacci Foundation and FEDELAT as “travel companions” in this initiative. All together, we hope that the event, which brings together experts from various parts of the world, will be of interest to you. </span></p><p dir="ltr" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.295; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt;"><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Marco Narvaez Tamayo</span><br /><span style="white-space: pre-wrap;">Giustino Varrassi</span></p>

title_it: MASTER CLASS in ALLERGY & RESPIRATORY MEDICINE: HOT TOPICS
title_en: MASTER CLASS in ALLERGY & RESPIRATORY MEDICINE: HOT TOPICS

We designed this program to give</div><div style="text-align: left;">the opportunity to young clinicians and researchers to be protagonist of the scientific</div><div style="text-align: left;">outcomes of this Masteclass</div><div style="text-align: left;">We welcome of all of you in Sydney for an exciting</div><div style="text-align: left;">MASTER CLASS in ALLERGY &amp; RESPIRATORY MEDICINE:HOT TOPICS<br /><br /></div><div><br /></div><div style="text-align: right;">Canonica Giorgio Walter</div>

title_it: MASTER CLASS ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE and NETWORK MEDICINE: PATH to PRECISION MEDICINE""
title_en: MASTER CLASS ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE and NETWORK MEDICINE: PATH to PRECISION MEDICINE""
presentationDescription_it: <span style="color: #333399;">Historically, scientific reductionism has provided the basis for our understanding of the causes of and treatments for disease. While this approach has often been successful, the great majority of diseases are complex and reflect many molecular interactions and responses defined by genomic context and environmental exposures. Given this complexity, the field of network medicine was developed, the fundamental principle of which is that a true understanding of disease definition, etiology, prognosis, and therapy requires a holistic approach to these complex molecular systems. In the current era of ‘big data’ and multi-omic data sets, we are poised to analyze these complex systems as seen through the lens of molecular interaction networks, including protein-protein interaction networks, Bayesian coexpression networks, and others. This new paradigm requires deep learning and artificial intelligence strategies, which, together, will guide us along the path to true precision medicine. Doing so requires a multidisciplinary approach involving experts in applied mathematics, biomedicine, computer science, engineering, and network science, and involves the development of novel analytical strategies for assessing the interactions among and between the elements of these multi-omic networks. This proposed symposium is designed to provide a contemporary, integrated view of this rapidly growing interdisciplinary paradigm, which offers the opportunity to identify novel personalized mechanisms of disease, unique biomarkers for disease prognosis, and novel drug targets for personalized therapies. In these ways, network medicine offers a novel path toward (re)defining and treating human disease in the modern era, and facilitates the development of precision medicine. <br /><br /> </span><p style="text-align: right;"> <strong><span style="color: #333399;">Joseph Loscalzo <br />&nbsp;Alberico L. Catapano</span></strong> </p>
presentationDescription_en: <span style="text-decoration-color: initial; color: #333399;">Historically, scientific reductionism has provided the basis for our understanding of the causes of and treatments for disease. While this approach has often been successful, the great majority of diseases are complex and reflect many molecular interactions and responses defined by genomic context and environmental exposures. Given this complexity, the field of network medicine was developed, the fundamental principle of which is that a true understanding of disease definition, etiology, prognosis, and therapy requires a holistic approach to these complex molecular systems. In the current era of ‘big data’ and multi-omic data sets, we are poised to analyze these complex systems as seen through the lens of molecular interaction networks, including protein-protein interaction networks, Bayesian coexpression networks, and others. This new paradigm requires deep learning and artificial intelligence strategies, which, together, will guide us along the path to true precision medicine. Doing so requires a multidisciplinary approach involving experts in applied mathematics, biomedicine, computer science, engineering, and network science, and involves the development of novel analytical strategies for assessing the interactions among and between the elements of these multi-omic networks. This proposed symposium is designed to provide a contemporary, integrated view of this rapidly growing interdisciplinary paradigm, which offers the opportunity to identify novel personalized mechanisms of disease, unique biomarkers for disease prognosis, and novel drug targets for personalized therapies. In these ways, network medicine offers a novel path toward (re)defining and treating human disease in the modern era, and facilitates the development of precision medicine.<br /><br /></span><p style="text-align: right;"><strong><span style="color: #333399;">Joseph Loscalzo<br />&nbsp;Alberico L. Catapano</span></strong></p><p style="text-align: right;"> </p>

title_it: CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASES CONNECTED TO RESPIRATORY DISEASES: FROM MECHANISMS TO THERAPEUTIC IMPLICATIONS
